contentrichtext.text: {{Politics of Fiji}} '''General elections''' were held in [[Fiji]] between 10 and 17 July 1982.<ref>Nohlen, D, Grotz, F & Hartmann, C (2001) ''Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II'', p653 ISBN 0-19-924959-8</ref> The paradoxical results were both a triumph and a setback for the [[Fijian Alliance|Fijian Alliance Party]] of the [[List of Prime Ministers of Fiji|Prime Minister]], [[Kamisese Mara|Ratu Sir Kamisese Mara]]. The Alliance captured an unprecedented 51.8 percent of the popular vote - the first time that it had received an [[absolute majority]]. However, it won only 28 seats, 8 fewer than at [[Fiji election of 1977 (September)|the previous election]] of September 1977. Part of the reason for this discrepancy was the surge in support for Ratu Mara's Alliance in the [[Indo-Fijian]] community, from 14 percent to almost 24 percent, was not sufficient to translate into seats in Fiji's communal electoral system, and did not therefore off-set losses among the [[Fijian people|ethnic Fijian]] community, particularly in the west of the country. The [[Western United Front (Fiji)|Western United Front]] of [[Osea Gavidi|Ratu Osea Gavidi]] won only two seats, but split the vote, allowing the [[National Federation Party (Fiji)|National Federation party]], with which it tactically allied itself, to pick up six seats for a total of 22. ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/- |- |align=left|[[Alliance Party (Fiji)|Alliance Party]]||507,163||51.8||28||-8 |- |align=left|[[National Federation Party (Fiji)|National Federation Party]]||403,548||41.2||22||+7 |- |align=left|[[Western United Front (Fiji)|Western United Front]]||37,266||3.8||2||New |- |align=left|[[Fijian Nationalist Party]]||27,329||2.8||0||0 |- |align=left|Independents||3,903||0.4||0||-1 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||19,605||-||-||- |- |align=left|'''Total'''||'''998,814'''||'''100'''||'''52'''||'''0''' |- |colspan=5 align=left|Source: Nohlen ''et al.'' |} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Fijian elections}} [[Category:Elections in Fiji|1982]] [[Category:1982 in Fiji]] [[Category:1982 elections in Oceania]]
